thread.title: Hawaii Governor signs emergency proclamation as Hurricane Ignacio nears islands
thread.title_full: Hawaii Governor signs emergency proclamation as Hurricane Ignacio nears islands

author: eTN Editor
title: Hawaii Governor signs emergency proclamation as Hurricane Ignacio nears islands
text:
Hawaii Governor signs emergency proclamation as Hurricane Ignacio nears islands   
Aug 29, 2015 Hawaii Goveror Ige   
Hurricane Ignacio is nearing the Hawaiian islands, and in anticipation of its potential threatening path, Hawaii Governor Ige has signed an emergency proclamation to activate a major disaster fund. Hawaii residents and tourists are being urged to be prepare now and to monitor the news. 
Weather forecasters are predicting the Hurricane could begin to cause damage to the Aloha state as soon as early next week. According to the National Weather Service, the projected path of the hurricane will likely bring it either right over Hawaii or to the north of the islands. 
Even if Hurricane Ignacio is downgraded to a tropical category 1 storm by then, it can still cause a lot of damage. Just these past few days there has been flooding in streams, roadways, and neighborhoods due to excessive rain caused by two tropical depressions that just passed by to the south of the islands. 
As has happened with the other storms that became tropical depressions, once the weather grouping gets nearer to the Hawaiian islands, they have lost their strength to due a wind shear and cooler waters that acts a natural storm diverter. 
Should there be need, however, for emergency services and resources, the signing of a proclamation now paves the way for smooth access to disaster relief from the Hawaii State legislature and federal services as well.
